trans-unit.source: Addressing Entities and Operations
trans-unit.target: Addressing Entities and Operations

trans-unit.source: Addressing Entities and Operations in the Graph API
trans-unit.target: Addressing Entities and Operations in the Graph API

trans-unit.source: This topic discusses different addressing alternatives that you can use when addressing directory entities, calling directory functions, performing queries against the directory or performing operations on directory entities and resource sets using Azure AD Graph API.
trans-unit.target: This topic discusses different addressing alternatives that you can use when addressing directory entities, calling directory functions, performing queries against the directory or performing operations on directory entities and resource sets using Azure AD Graph API.

trans-unit.source: For more detailed information about performing specific operations or queries, addressing directory entities, or calling functions, see the appropriate topic in this documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more detailed information about performing specific operations or queries, addressing directory entities, or calling functions, see the appropriate topic in this documentation.

trans-unit.source: For information about performing queries against the directory, see <link xlink:href="3f3199df-de7d-49ff-92d2-58c8e3e9c9e9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph Common Queries</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about performing queries against the directory, see <link xlink:href="3f3199df-de7d-49ff-92d2-58c8e3e9c9e9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph Common Queries</link>.

trans-unit.source: For information about directory entities and the operations that can be performed on them as well as about functions that are exposed by Graph, see the relevant topic in the <link xlink:href="5bf59753-8af5-4189-b682-fee1a58263ac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph REST API Reference</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about directory entities and the operations that can be performed on them as well as about functions that are exposed by Graph, see the relevant topic in the <link xlink:href="5bf59753-8af5-4189-b682-fee1a58263ac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph REST API Reference</link>.

trans-unit.source: Tenant Addressing
trans-unit.target: Tenant Addressing

trans-unit.source: You can address your tenant in one of three ways:
trans-unit.target: You can address your tenant in one of three ways:

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>By tenant object ID.</legacyBold> This is a GUID that was assigned when the tenant was created.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>By tenant object ID.</legacyBold> This is a GUID that was assigned when the tenant was created.

trans-unit.source: It is equivalent to the <system>objectId</system> property of the <link xlink:href="392e345d-b226-4b34-bd88-fcd28df01474" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">TenantDetail</link> object.
trans-unit.target: It is equivalent to the <system>objectId</system> property of the <link xlink:href="392e345d-b226-4b34-bd88-fcd28df01474" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">TenantDetail</link> object.

trans-unit.source: The following URL shows how to address the top-level resources of a tenant’s directory by using the object ID: https://graph.windows.net/12345678-9abc-def0-1234-56789abcde/?api-version=1.5.
trans-unit.target: The following URL shows how to address the top-level resources of a tenant’s directory by using the object ID: https://graph.windows.net/12345678-9abc-def0-1234-56789abcde/?api-version=1.5.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>By verified (registered) domain name.</legacyBold> This is one of the domain names that are registered for the tenant.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>By verified (registered) domain name.</legacyBold> This is one of the domain names that are registered for the tenant.

trans-unit.source: These can be found in the <system>verifiedDomains</system> property of the <link xlink:href="392e345d-b226-4b34-bd88-fcd28df01474" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">TenantDetail</link> object.
trans-unit.target: These can be found in the <system>verifiedDomains</system> property of the <link xlink:href="392e345d-b226-4b34-bd88-fcd28df01474" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">TenantDetail</link> object.

trans-unit.source: The following URL shows how to address the top-level resources of a tenant that has the domain contoso.com: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/?api-version=1.5.
trans-unit.target: The following URL shows how to address the top-level resources of a tenant that has the domain contoso.com: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/?api-version=1.5.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>By using the “MyOrganization” alias.</legacyBold> This alias is only available when using OAuth Authorization Code Grant type (3-legged) authentication.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>By using the “MyOrganization” alias.</legacyBold> This alias is only available when using OAuth Authorization Code Grant type (3-legged) authentication.

trans-unit.source: The alias is not case sensitive.
trans-unit.target: The alias is not case sensitive.

trans-unit.source: It replaces the object ID or tenant domain in the URL.
trans-unit.target: It replaces the object ID or tenant domain in the URL.

trans-unit.source: When the alias is used, Graph API derives the tenant from the claims presented in the token attached to the request.
trans-unit.target: When the alias is used, Graph API derives the tenant from the claims presented in the token attached to the request.

trans-unit.source: The following URL shows how to address the top-level resources of a tenant using this alias: https://graph.windows.net/myorganization/?api-version=1.5.
trans-unit.target: The following URL shows how to address the top-level resources of a tenant using this alias: https://graph.windows.net/myorganization/?api-version=1.5.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>By using the “Me” alias.</legacyBold> This alias is only available when using OAuth Authorization Code Grant type (3-legged) authentication.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>By using the “Me” alias.</legacyBold> This alias is only available when using OAuth Authorization Code Grant type (3-legged) authentication.

trans-unit.source: The alias is not case sensitive.
trans-unit.target: The alias is not case sensitive.

trans-unit.source: It replaces the object ID or tenant domain in the URL.
trans-unit.target: It replaces the object ID or tenant domain in the URL.

trans-unit.source: When the alias is used, Graph API derives the user from the claims presented in the token attached to the request.
trans-unit.target: When the alias is used, Graph API derives the user from the claims presented in the token attached to the request.

trans-unit.source: The following URL can be used to call the <link xlink:href="64ba0b59-8ae8-4c7b-b3ce-61f417318b59" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">getMemberGroups</link> function to return the transitive group memberships of the current user: https://graph.windows.net/me/getMemberGroups?api-version=1.5.
trans-unit.target: The following URL can be used to call the <link xlink:href="64ba0b59-8ae8-4c7b-b3ce-61f417318b59" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">getMemberGroups</link> function to return the transitive group memberships of the current user: https://graph.windows.net/me/getMemberGroups?api-version=1.5.

trans-unit.source: (Note: a request body must also be supplied with the POST request.)
trans-unit.target: (Note: a request body must also be supplied with the POST request.)
